wikipedia_page.main: Harry Grant was a British racing cyclist who specialised in motor-paced events. He was national amateur champion in 1926, 1928 and 1931. At the time he turned professional in 1932 he held four British amateur track records. He also won many races on the continent and held the world paced one-hour record on three occasions.

response: Harry Grant was a racing driver.
Harry Grant may also refer to:
*Harry Grant (rugby league) (born 1998), Australian rugby league player

The quality of his frames were recognised by some of the greatest cyclists of the time, like Harry Grant, who broke the World Motor-paced One Hour Record using a Selbach frame, and Albert Richter, who won the 1932 Amateur World Sprint Championship.
